Maddie_&_Tae:
{{short description|American female country music duo}}
{{Infobox musical artist
| name            = Maddie & Tae
| image           = Maddie & Tae in 2014 (cropped).jpg
| caption         = Maddie Font (left) and Tae Kerr (right) in 2014
| origin          = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], U.S.

| label           = [[Mercury Nashville]]
| current_members = {{hlist|Maddie Font|Tae Kerr}}
}}

'''Maddie & Tae''' are an American female [[country music]] duo composed of Maddie Font (née Marlow) and Tae Kerr (née Dye),<ref name="Source">{{cite web | url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/country-stars-maddie-tae-on-touring-with-brad-paisley-and-new-fashion-line/ | title=Country stars Maddie & Tae on touring with Brad Paisley and new fashion line| date= September 29, 2016| publisher = CBS News |quote= CBS caught up with Madison Marlow and Taylor Dye at the launch event to talk about their youthful clothing line| access-date= 2016-11-10}}</ref> both of whom are singers, songwriters, and guitarists. The duo was signed to the revived [[Dot Records]] in 2014.<ref name="Linda Lee">{{cite web|last1=Lee|first1=Linda|title=Math Just Does Not Add Up For Maddie & Tae! [Podcast]|url=http://wycd.cbslocal.com/2014/11/12/math-just-does-not-add-up-for-maddie-tae-podcast/|publisher=WYCD|access-date=November 21, 2014|date=November 12, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141118111346/http://wycd.cbslocal.com/2014/11/12/math-just-does-not-add-up-for-maddie-tae-podcast/|archive-date=November 18, 2014|url-status=dead}}</ref> Their debut album, ''[[Start Here]]'', was released on August 28, 2015, and includes the singles "[[Girl in a Country Song]]", "[[Fly (Maddie & Tae song)|Fly]]", "[[Shut Up and Fish]]", and "[[Sierra (song)|Sierra]]". Following the closure of Dot, they signed to [[Mercury Nashville]] in 2018. They released their second studio album ''[[The Way It Feels (Maddie & Tae album)|The Way It Feels]]'' for this label in April 2020, and the first part of their third studio album, ''Through The Madness'' in 2022.

== Career ==
===2010–2016: Early beginnings and ''Start Here''===
In 2010, Maddie Marlow and Tae Dye were both going to the same vocal coach and met at a showcase in [[Dallas, Texas|Dallas]]. Within the year, the duo was going back and forth to Nashville every weekend while still going to school.<ref>{{cite web|author=Jill Menze |url=http://www.teenvogue.com/story/maddie-and-tae-start-here-album-interview |title=Meet Maddie & Tae, Nashville's Newest Sensation |publisher=Teen Vogue |date=2015-08-05 |access-date=2016-04-27}}</ref> They first performed under the name Sweet Aliana. After finishing high school, the duo moved to [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]], to begin their musical career as Maddie & Tae.<ref name="official">{{cite web|url=http://www.maddieandtae.com/about/ |title=About |work=Maddie & Tae official website |access-date=14 August 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140814183514/http://www.maddieandtae.com/about/ |archive-date=14 August 2014 }}</ref> In 2014, [[Big Machine Records]] revived the [[Dot Records]] name for a new imprint. Maddie & Tae were confirmed as the first signees of the label in June 2014.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/exclusive-dot-records-signs-duo-maddie-tae-as-first-act-20140601|title=Exclusive: Dot Records Signs Duo Maddie & Tae as First Act|magazine=Rolling Stone|date=June 2014|access-date=3 September 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.roughstock.com/blog/dot-records-signs-maddie-tae-to-recording-contract|title=Dot Records Signs Maddie & Tae To Recording Contract
 |access-date=February 4, 2016 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714212321/http://www.roughstock.com/blog/dot-records-signs-maddie-tae-to-recording-contract |archive-date=July 14, 2014 }}</ref>

They wrote their debut single, "Girl in a Country Song", with Aaron Scherz, who co-produced it with [[Dann Huff]]. The song is a criticism of the then-contemporary [[bro-country]] trend.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/entertainment/archive/2014/07/girl-in-a-country-song-maddie-marlow-and-tae-dye-the-bro-country-backlash-starts-now/373982/|title=The Bro-Country Backlash Is Here|author=Gina Dalfonzo|work=The Atlantic|date=7 July 2014|access-date=3 September 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.roughstock.com/blog/has-the-bro-country-backlash-begun- |title=Has the Bro-Country "Backlash" Begun?|access-date=February 4, 2016 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714212835/http://www.roughstock.com/blog/has-the-bro-country-backlash-begun- |archive-date=July 14, 2014 }}</ref> "Girl in a Country Song" debuted at number 58 on the [[Country Airplay]] chart dated for the week ending July 19, 2014.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/6150343/chart-highlights-usher-lands-lucky-13th-no-1-on-rbhip-hop|title=Chart Highlights: Usher Lands Lucky 13th No. 1 On R&B/Hip-Hop Airplay|magazine=Billboard|access-date=3 September 2015}}</ref> After 23 weeks, it reached number 1 for the chart dated December 20, 2014, becoming the first debut single by a female duo to reach number one since [[The Wreckers]] did it in 2006 with "[[Leave the Pieces]]", and only the second in history.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/6386054/chart-highlights-maddie-tae-girls-in-a-no-1-country-song|title=Chart Highlights: Maddie & Tae, Girls in a No. 1 Country Song|author=Gary Trust and Wade Jessen|date=December 8, 2014|publisher=Billboard.com|access-date=December 18, 2014}}</ref> Maddie & Tae released their self-titled [[Extended play|EP]] on November 4, 2014. It featured "Girl in a Country Song" as well as three new tracks: "Sierra", "[[Fly (Maddie & Tae song)|Fly]]", and "Your Side of Town".

"Fly" was released on January 26, 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newsok.com/listen-maddie-tae-release-new-single-fly/article/5381984|title=Listen: Maddie & Tae release new single "Fly"|work=NewsOK.com|access-date=3 September 2015}}</ref> It made its television debut when they performed the song on ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon]]''.<ref name="rollingstone.com">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/videos/watch-maddie-and-tae-debut-empowering-fly-on-the-tonight-show-20150126|title=Maddie and Tae Perform New Song 'Fly' on 'The Tonight Show'|magazine=Rolling Stone|date=26 January 2015|access-date=3 September 2015}}</ref> Their debut album, ''[[Start Here]]'', was released on August 28, 2015.<ref name="rollingstone.com" /> By October 2015, the song had become a Top 10 hit on both Hot Country Songs and Country Airplay. The duo co-wrote the track "Boomerang" on [[Jana Kramer]]'s late 2015 album ''[[Thirty One (Jana Kramer album)|Thirty One]]''.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Paxman|first=Bob|date=October 19, 2015|title=Reviews: Jana Kramer - ''Thirty One''|journal=Nash Country Weekly|volume=22|issue=42|page=23|issn=2379-9137}}</ref> The album's third single, "[[Shut Up and Fish]]" released to country radio on November 2, 2015. The album's fourth single, "Sierra", was released to country radio in 2016.

Maddie and Tae guest-starred on the [[Disney Channel]] show ''[[Girl Meets World]]'' in an episode entitled "Girl Meets Texas, Part 2", which premiered on October 17, 2015.<ref>{{cite web |last1=McClellan |first1=Laura |title=Maddie & Tae to Cameo on Disney Channel's 'Girl Meets World' |url=http://tasteofcountry.com/maddie-tae-girl-meets-world/ |website=Taste of Country |date=16 October 2015 |access-date=19 December 2018 |language=en}}</ref> They performed at [[The O2 Arena]], on the main stage of the [[C2C: Country to Country]] festival in March 2016 – their first visit to the UK.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.entertainment-focus.com/music-section/music-reviews/live/c2c-country-to-country-2016-maddie-tae-live-review/|title=C2C: Country to Country 2016 – Maddie & Tae live review|date=12 March 2016}}</ref> They released a fashion line in collaboration with [[Bloomingdales]] in late 2016.<ref name="The Boot Feb 17">{{cite web|last1=Thompson|first1=Gayle|title=Maddie & Tae Are 'So Anxious' to Release Their Sophomore Album|url=http://theboot.com/maddie-and-tae-new-music-2017/|website=The Boot|date=19 February 2017 |access-date=31 March 2017}}</ref>

===2017–present: ''The Way It Feels'' and EP releases===
In early 2017, Maddie and Tae appeared on [[Forbes]]' [[Forbes 30 Under 30|30 Under 30]] - Music list at #20.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Bonaguro|first1=Alison|title=Kelsea Ballerini Named No. 2 Forbes' "30 Under 30" List|url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1775317/kelsea-ballerini-named-no-2-forbes-30-under-30-list/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170105062545/http://www.cmt.com/news/1775317/kelsea-ballerini-named-no-2-forbes-30-under-30-list/|url-status=dead|archive-date=January 5, 2017|website=CMT News}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Maddie & Tae|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/maddie-tae/|website=Forbes|access-date=5 January 2017}}</ref> They received two nominations for the 52nd annual [[Academy of Country Music]] Awards, including Vocal Duo of the Year.<ref name="ACM Noms 2017">{{cite web|title=Nominees |url=http://www.acmawards.com/nominees |website=The ACM Awards |access-date=28 March 2017 |language=en |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160308114318/http://www.acmawards.com/nominees |archive-date=8 March 2016 }}</ref> In June 2017, it was announced that Maddie and Tae had signed with UMG Nashville following the closing of Dot Records.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Thompson|first1=Gayle|title=Maddie & Tae Have Signed With UMG Nashville|url=http://theboot.com/maddie-and-tae-umg-nashville/|website=The Boot|date=10 June 2017 |access-date=10 June 2017}}</ref>

In early 2018, Maddie & Tae signed with [[Universal Music Group Nashville|Mercury Nashville]] and released the single "Friends Don't."<ref>{{cite magazine | url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/8459385/maddie-tae-start-friends-dont | title=Maddie & Tae Start An Evolution With Mercury Debut, 'Friends Don't' | magazine=Billboard | date=June 5, 2018 | access-date=October 17, 2018}}</ref> It has since peaked at number 33 on the ''Billboard'' Country Airplay charts.  In October 2018, the duo released another new song, "Die from a Broken Heart",<ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/die-from-a-broken-heart/1438573467|title=Die From A Broken Heart by Maddie & Tae on Apple Music|website=[[Apple Music]]|access-date=October 20, 2018}}</ref> and it sold 7,000 in its first week.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://roughstock.com/news/2018/11/43496-top-30-digital-country-singles-chart-november-7-2018|title=Top 30 Digital Country Singles Chart: November 7, 2018|work=RoughStock|access-date=November 8, 2018}}</ref> The song has reached a peak of number 2 on the US Country Chart and number 1 on Country Airplay chart. This makes the duo's first number one since their debut single. The duo is an opening act on [[Carrie Underwood]]'s [[Cry Pretty Tour 360]] which began on May 1, 2019.<ref>{{cite magazine |last1=Kaufman |first1=Gil |title=Carrie Underwood Announces The Cry Pretty Tour 360 With All-Female Bill: See the Dates |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/8469238/carrie-underwood-announces-tour-dates-2019 |magazine=Billboard |access-date=19 December 2018}}</ref> In March 2019, the duo released another promotional single entitled "Tourist in This Town."<ref name="tasteofcountry.com">{{cite web |last1=Despres |first1=Tricia |title=Maddie & Tae's 'Tourist in This Town' Confronts Past Pain |url=https://tasteofcountry.com/maddie-and-tae-tourist-in-this-town/ |website=Taste of Country |date=March 2019 |access-date=24 April 2019 |language=en}}</ref> Their EP ''One Heart to Another'' was released on April 26, 2019.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Kruh |first1=Nancy |title=As New EP Debuts, Maddie & Tae Celebrate Why Carrie Underwood Chose Them for Her Tour |url=https://people.com/country/maddie-and-tae-one-heart-to-another-ep-carrie-underwood-tour/ |website=PEOPLE.com |access-date=1 May 2019 |language=en}}</ref>

Their second studio album, ''[[The Way It Feels (Maddie & Tae album)|The Way It Feels]],'' was released on April 10, 2020.<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/maddie-tae-new-album-the-way-it-feels-947605/|title=Maddie & Tae Detail New Album 'The Way It Feels'|last1=Freeman|first1=Jon|date=2020-02-04|magazine=Rolling Stone|language=en-US|access-date=2020-02-05}}</ref> A Christmas music EP, ''We Need Christmas'', followed on October 23, 2020.<ref name="we need christmas">{{cite news |last1=Parton |first1=Chris |title=Maddie & Tae Announce 'We Need Christmas' Album |url=https://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/maddie-tae-announce-we-need-christmas/ |access-date=September 21, 2020 |work=Sounds Like Nashville |date=September 21, 2020}}</ref> In November 2021, Tae revealed that she and her husband were expecting their first child in the spring of 2022.<ref>{{cite web |last=Balagtas |first= Tristan|title=Maddie & Tae's Taylor Dye Is Pregnant! Country Star Expecting Baby Girl with Husband Josh Kerr|url=https://people.com/parents/taylor-dye-is-pregnant-expecting-baby-girl-husband-josh-kerr/ |website=PEOPLE.com |access-date=November 21, 2021}}</ref> 

The first volume of the pair's third studio album, the EP ''[[Through the Madness, Vol. 1]]'', was released on January 28, 2022.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Dowling |first=Marcus K. |date=December 14, 2021 |title=Maddie & Tae Reveal New EP ''Through the Madness Vol. 1'' |work=CMT |url=https://www.cmt.com/news/1840062/maddie-tae-reveal-new-ep-through-the-madness-vol-1/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211215003444/http://www.cmt.com/news/1840062/maddie-tae-reveal-new-ep-through-the-madness-vol-1/ |url-status=dead |archive-date=December 15, 2021 |access-date=June 19, 2022}}</ref> That same year, they embarked on their "All Song No Static Tour", with Abbey Cone and [[Sacha (singer)|Sacha]] as supporting acts.<ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.kixbrooksradio.com/2021/12/14/maddie-tae-are-kicking-off-2022-with-a-tour-and-new-music/|title=Maddie & Tae Are Kicking Off 2022 With a Tour and New Music|date=December 14, 2021|work=Kix Brooks Radio|access-date=August 23, 2023}}</ref>

==Members==
===Maddie Font===
Madison Kay "Maddie" Font (née Marlow)<ref>{{cite web|url=https://mobile.ascap.com/aceclient/AceClient/#ace/writer/3550600/MARLOW%20MADISON%20KAY|title=ASCAP ACE Search|work=ascap.com|access-date=3 September 2015|archive-date=15 January 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160115083213/https://mobile.ascap.com/aceclient/AceClient/#ace/writer/3550600/MARLOW%20MADISON%20KAY|url-status=dead}}</ref> (born July 7, 1995) was raised in [[Sugar Land, Texas]]. She graduated from [[George Ranch High School]] in 2013.<ref>{{cite web|title=2013 GRHS graduate, Maddie Marlow (of Maddie & Tae), is debuting on the Today show this morning! The duo will be singing their hit "Girl in a Country Song".|url=https://www.facebook.com/LamarCISD/posts/2013-grhs-graduate-maddie-marlow-of-maddie-tae-is-debuting-on-the-today-show-thi/778213822220565/|website=Facebook|access-date=January 19, 2024|language=en|date=August 11, 2014}}</ref>

She is the duo's lead vocalist and also plays guitar and mandolin. 

On November 22, 2019, Maddie married Jonah Font after eight years of dating.<ref>{{cite web |last=Tracy |first=Brianne |title=Maddie & Tae's Maddie Marlow Marries Jonah Font: All the Details from Their Tennessee Wedding |url=https://people.com/country/maddie-marlow-marries-jonah-font-wedding-photo/ |website=PEOPLE.com |access-date=November 30, 2019 |language=en}}</ref> On September 9, 2023, the couple welcomed their first child, a son.<ref>{{cite web |last=Sacks|first=Hannah |title=Maddie & Tae's Maddie Marlow Welcomes First Baby, Son Forrest, After Emergency C-Section: 'So In Love' |url=https://people.com/maddie-and-taes-maddie-marlow-font-welcomes-first-baby-with-husband-7775355|website=PEOPLE.com |access-date=January 19, 2024 |language=en}}</ref>

===Tae Kerr===
Taylor Elizabeth "Tae" Kerr (née Dye)<ref>{{cite web|url=https://mobile.ascap.com/aceclient/AceClient/#ace/writer/3700444/DYE%20TAYLOR%20ELIZABETH|title=ASCAP ACE Search|work=ascap.com|access-date=3 September 2015|archive-date=15 January 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160115083213/https://mobile.ascap.com/aceclient/AceClient/#ace/writer/3700444/DYE%20TAYLOR%20ELIZABETH|url-status=dead}}</ref> (born September 18, 1995) was raised in [[Ada, Oklahoma]]. She has two older brothers, one of whom is actor [[Mason Dye]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Maddie & Tae Have a Close Connection To This Season of Stranger Things |url=https://pressroom.umgnashville.com/news/maddie-tae-have-a-close-connection-to-this-season-of-stranger-things/|website=UMG Nashville|access-date=January 19, 2024|language=en}}</ref> She graduated from [[Silo High School]] in 2013.

She is the duo's harmony vocalist and also plays left-handed guitar and piano.

On February 21, 2020, Tae married songwriter Josh Kerr after over a year of dating.<ref>{{cite web |last=Mauch |first=Ally |title=They're Married! Maddie & Tae's Taylor Dye Weds Josh Kerr|url=https://people.com/country/taylor-dye-marries-josh-kerr/ |website=PEOPLE.com |access-date=February 22, 2020}}</ref> On January 17, 2022, they welcomed their first child, a daughter, who was born three months early.<ref>{{cite web |last=Rice |first= Nicholas |title=Maddie & Tae's Taylor Dye Gives Birth to First Baby with Husband Josh Kerr 3 Months Early|url=https://people.com/parents/maddie-tae-taylor-dye-gives-birth-to-first-baby-3-months-early/ |website=PEOPLE.com |access-date=January 17, 2022}}</ref> In June 2024, the couple announced that they are expecting their second child, a boy.<ref>{{cite web |last=Sacks |first= Hannah |title=Maddie & Tae's Taylor Dye Expecting Baby No. 2 with Husband Josh Kerr: 'Couldn't Be More Excited'|url=https://people.com/maddie-and-tae-s-taylor-dye-expecting-baby-no-2-with-husband-josh-kerr-8661737 |website=PEOPLE.com |access-date=July 13, 2024}}</ref>

* [[Storyteller Tour: Stories in the Round]] (2016) with [[Carrie Underwood]] and [[Little Big Town]] and [[Sam Hunt]]
